title: A Little Bird I Am
author: Madame Jeanne-Marie Bouvier de la Motte-Guyon (1648-1717) bio
music: From Hymns of Worship and Remembrance

v1: Shut from the fields of air,
And in my cage I sit and sing
To Him who placed me there;
Well pleased a prisoner to be,
Because, my God, it pleaseth Thee.
v2: Nought have I else to do,
I sing the whole day long;
And He whom most I love to please
He caught and bound my wand'ring wing;
But still He bends to hear me sing.
v3: Thou hast an ear to hear
A heart to love and bless;
And though my notes were e'er so rude,
Thou wouldst not hear the less;
Because Thou knowest as they fall,
That love, sweet love, inspires them all.
v4: But though my wing is closely bound,
The flight, the freedom of the soul.
v5: O it is good to soar
To Him whose purpose I adore,
And in Thy mighty will to find
The joy, the freedom of the mind.
